reference_a:
@article{neubauer2024,
  title = {Approaching academic adjustment on multiple time scales},
  author = {Neubauer, Andreas B. and Schmiedek, Florian},
  date = {2024-02-01},
  journaltitle = {Zeitschrift für Erziehungswissenschaft},
  shortjournal = {Z Erziehungswiss},
  volume = {27},
  number = {1},
  pages = {147--168},
  issn = {1862-5215},
  doi = {10.1007/s11618-023-01182-8}
}
topics: timescales, COVID, academic achievement, study demands
additional_comments: part of the STECCO project; number of participants higher than that included in the paper; more panel datasets available on OSF; some variables use "-1" for "not applicable"

features.name: question_nr
features.coding:
Other categories available for panel data, here: 
dxby = ESM questionnaires; dx indicates the respective day of the ESM phase (x = 1-14), by indicates the respective beep of the day (with y = 1-5 representing quasi-randomized beeps and y = 6 representing end of day questionnaires.

features.name: timestamp
features.coding: Time stamp denoting the quasi randomized time point when the questionnaire was sent out to the particpant

features.name: location
features.coding:
Where are you right now?  1 = At home
2 = With friends
3 = At my university
4 = On the bus, in the train, in the car 5 = Shopping / running errands
6 = Outside (walking, doing sports, ...) 7 = At my workplace
8 = Elsewhere, namely:

features.name: number_of_company
features.coding: Are you currently with others or alone? You can select multiple answers. Total number of selected responses

features.name: alone
features.coding:
alone
FALSE = not selected TRUE = selected

features.coding:
with partner
FALSE = not selected TRUE = selected

features.coding:

features.name: studied
features.coding:
Have you worked for your studies since getting up / since the last survey?
Think of all possible study- related tasks (e.g., attending lectures, working on exercises, reading or researching literature, ...).
1 = yes 2 = no

features.name: number_study_activities
features.coding: What did you do? You can select multiple answers.

features.name: attended_lecture_seminar
features.coding:
Attended a lecture, seminar or lab
FALSE = not selected TRUE = selected

features.name: held_presentation
features.coding:
Held a presentation in one of my classes
FALSE = not selected TRUE = selected

features.name: group_work
features.coding:
Worked in a group as part of an exercise, laboratory, etc.

other, namely:
FALSE = not selected TRUE = selected

features.name: time_spent_studying
features.coding:
How long have you worked for your studies since getting up/ sincethe last survey?
1 = Less than half an hour 
2 = Half an hour to an hour 
3 = One hour to two hours 
4 = Two to three hours 
5 = More than three hours

features.coding: What did you do since getting up / since the last survey? You can select multiple answers.

features.name: supposed_to_study
features.coding:
Were you supposed to have been working for your studies since getting up / since the last survey?
1 = No, I was at leisure time. 
2 = Yes, but I decided against it.

features.name: study_motivation_others_disappointed
features.coding:
...because others would have been disappointed in me if I had not done so
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_felt_bad
features.coding:
...because I would have felt bad if I had not done this.
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_important
features.coding:
...because the work I did was personally important to me
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_interesting
features.coding:
...because I found the work interesting
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_compulsory
features.coding:
...because I had to (e.g. because of a compulsory course, or as a prerequisite for a seminar).
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_proving
features.coding:
..because I wanted to prove to myself or others that I can do something well.
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_understanding
features.coding:
..because I wanted to understand the contents of my studies better.
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

features.name: study_motivation_enjoyment
features.coding:
..because I enjoyed the work.
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree

1 = completely disagree

...because I found the activity interesting
1 = completely disagree

1 = completely disagree

1 = completely disagree

features.name: see_good_in_bad
features.coding:
I have tried to see the good aspects in a bad situation as well.
1 = not at all
7 = very
-1 = not applicable

features.name: focus_on_good
features.coding:
I focused on the good aspects of my situation to feel better.
1 = not at all
7 = very
-1 = not applicable

features.name: suppression
features.coding:
I suppressed my feelings.
1 = not at all
7 = very
-1 = not applicable

features.name: changed_feeling
features.coding:
I changed my feelings by thinking differently about my current situation.
1 = not at all
7 = very
-1 = not applicable

features.name: rumination
features.coding:
I have thought about my feelings or situation over and over again.
1 = not at all
7 = very
-1 = not applicable

features.name: finished
features.coding:
Variable indicating whether the participant reached the goodbye page or not
FALSE = Did not reach good-bye-page
TRUE = Reached good-by page

features.name: last_page
features.description: The page most recently answered (and sent via the next button) by the participant

features.name: max_page
features.description: The greatest number of any page answered by the participant.

features.name: too_late
features.coding:
Variable indicating if participants had answered parts of the questionnaire later than intended (i.e., later than the time point when the questionnaire was officially closed). Responses given later than inetnded were set to missing.
0 = all responses given within acceptable time frame
1 = (parts of the) responses given later than intended

features.name: noncompliance_esm
features.coding:
Variable coding if a participant has completed less than 5 beeps per week or has participated only 1 day within a week. Evaluated separately for both study weeks
0 = more than 5 beeps and more than 1 day of data collection
1 = at least 5 beeps but not more than 1 day of data collection
2 = less than 5 beeps but more than 1 day of data collection

features.name: source
features.coding:
esm = ESM data
daily = end-of-day survey data

features.name: mother_autonomy
features.coding:
Today my mother allowed me to make choices of my own.
1= completely disagree
